revised_title: Effect of Alcohol and Exercise on the Elimination of Nitrogen and Body Functions
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Human Physiology
tldr: The author conducted experiments on a soldier to study the effects of alcohol and exercise on the elimination of nitrogen and body functions. They found that exercise slightly increased the elimination of nitrogen, while alcohol had no significant effect. The study also showed that the body's pulse rate increased with alcohol consumption and during exercise. These findings support the idea that intellectual and moral gifts, like physical qualities, are inherited traits.
